name: roytang
text: @jaredwhite I understand completely, but I think I like the term "generalist" much more than "full stack"; the latter is a more recent neologism arising from the need for specialists due to the rise of as you say unnecessary complexity; I don't think I ever used the term "full stack" before say 2014, most web devs I knew of back then were simply familiar with the entire stack by default
